title: What specific financial instruments does GE have classified as Level 3 in FY 2008? Separate the different instruments and the total amount. Express the answer in $M rounded to 2 decimal places of precision
description:
1) Retrieve the Level 3 instrument amounts from GE’s FY 2008 Form 10-K, in $M: 
 
 2) Investment securities: $12,956.00
 
 3) Derivatives (assets): $1,142.00
 
 4) Other assets: $1,105.00
 
 5) Derivatives (liabilities): $166.00.
 
 6) Calculate totals, in $M: Total Level 3 assets = $12,956.00 + $1,142.00 + $1,105.00 = $15,203.00
 
 7) Total Level 3 liabilities = $166.00
 
 7) Combined Level 3 (assets + liabilities) = $15,203.00 + $166.00 = $15,369.00.
answer: Investment securities: $12,956.00M; Derivatives (assets): $1,142.00M; Other (assets — private equity investments and loans designated under the fair value option): $1,105.00M; Derivatives (liabilities): $166.00M. Total Level 3 assets = $15,203.00M; total Level 3 liabilities = $166.00M; combined Level 3 = $15,369.00M.

rubric.criteria: Amounts are stated as retrieved from GE’s FY 2008 Form 10-K and presented in $M
Other assets (private equity investments and loans designated under the fair value option): $1,105.00M
All amounts are expressed in $M and rounded to two decimal places
